intro: Albertisia exelliana, commonly known as the Cape mountain thistle, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, hairy stems and purple to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, sandy, or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. It has small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Albertisia exelliana is adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in fynbos vegetation.
